summary: Congress has long been interested in knowing how much fraud exists across the federal government. But reliably determining how often fraud occurs—and its impact—is especially challenging. In this "GAOverview," we discuss 3 key challenges. Specifically: Agencies define fraud differently, making fraud and related data difficult to study across agencies Because of the deceptive nature of fraud, it isn't always detected or reported Existing data on...
title: GAOverview: Fraud in the Federal Government – Challenges Determining the Extent of Federal Fraud
